vision.notes: Sensory capabilities related to sight are unknown based on provided context.

mechanoreception.notes: As bryozoans, Fredericellidae likely possess mechanoreceptors to detect water currents and vibrations for feeding and predator avoidance. This is inferred from the general biology of similar aquatic invertebrates.

chemoreception.notes: Chemoreception is likely used to detect food particles and other chemical cues in the water. This is a common sensory modality in aquatic invertebrates.
